thread.title: Chafee to address future of campaign on Friday
thread.title_full: Chafee to address future of campaign on Friday

title: Chafee to address future of campaign on Friday
text:
Updated: 10:17 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 | Posted: 10:16 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 Chafee to address future of campaign on Friday By KEN THOMAS The Associated Press WASHINGTON â€” 
Democratic presidential candidate Lincoln Chafee said Thursday that he will address the future of his campaign Friday following a sluggish debate performance and difficulties gaining traction against Hillary Rodham Clinton and Bernie Sanders. 
The former Rhode Island governor and U.S. senator wrote on Twitter Thursday evening that he was looking forward to speaking at a Democratic National Committee women's forum Friday morning. "I'll address my future in the campaign there," he said. 
A Chafee spokeswoman did not respond to messages. 
During the first presidential debate, Chafee referred to himself as a "block of granite" when it came to issues and said he was most proud of his judgment, particularly his vote against the Iraq war. But his performance was widely panned, prompting questions about whether he will continue his campaign. 
Chafee, a former Republican who became an independent before joining the Democratic party, has said he would carry on his campaign as long as he can keep raising important issues. 
Chafee raised just $11,000 in the most recent fundraising quarter. Most of his money has come from more than $360,000 that he has loaned his campaign. Copyright The Associated Press
